enumtype.description: The status indicates the condition which the CronJob is in

value.description: The CronJob's execution has previously been canceled, so it has been restarted and is currently still running
The CronJob is being executed right now

The CronJob's execution has been interrupted in its execution, either automatically by a piece of business logic or manually by user intervention. You will need to resume the CronJob's execution if you want it to finish its run.
The CronJob has completed its run
The CronJob's execution has been cancelled - either due to an error or due to user intervention. Check the CronJob's log for details
Most probably, a CronJob in this state has never been run before

enumtype.description: The result reports on how the CronJob's last run was.

value.description: The CronJob was executed without running into any problems

The CronJob has completed its run on schedule, but it was not successful for some reason. Unlike the 'ERROR' result, this indicates a planned completion of the CronJob. Check the CronJob's log for details.

There was a problem during the CronJob's run (for example, the Java Virtual Machine was terminated or there was a system exception). Unlike the {literal}FAILURE{literal} status, this status indicates an uncontrolled termination of the CronJob. Check the CronJob's log for details.
No result is available. Most probably the CronJob has never been started yet.

targetElement.description: list of cronjobs/jobs which will be executed

sourceElement.description: References to the Job assigned to the CronJob

targetElement.description: CronJobs the job is assigned to

attribute.description: Node ID

the priority. @since 2.10

the error mode. @since 2.10
Whether the CronJob's execution log is written to a log file
Whether the CronJob's execution log is written to a log entry in the hybris Suite's database
Specifies the log level for logging to the file
Specifies the log level for logging to the database
A list of log files related to the current CronJob
The user in whose context (access rights, restrictions, etc) the CronJob will be executed
The system language to execute the CronJob in
The system currency with which to execute the CronJob
the sessioncontext values. @since 2.20
Whether the CronJob is active (is run when its trigger is due). If set to false, the CronJob will not be executed if its trigger is due

If an assigned job can't be started because of an already running job, a trigger will be created for the the cronjob instance with current time as activation time. This one will be triggerd on next poll repeatedly till the cronjob gets executed once
If the assigned TriggerableJob instance can not be performed yet, a new Trigger for this CronJob will be created
The e-mail address to which to send a notification on the CronJob's execution
Whether a status e-mail is to be sent after the CronJob's execution
The CronJob's execution status
The CronJob's execution result
The number of the cluster node on which the CronJob is to be run. This setting is relevant for clustered hybris Suite installations only.
the priority. @since 2.10
If set to true, the CronJob is removed from the hybris Suite after execution
All JobLogs (JobLogModels) older than this value in days will be removed
All JobLogs (JobLogModels) above this value will be removed

All LogFiles (LogFileModels) older than this value in days will be removed
All LogFiles (LogFileModels) above this value will be removed
